content: This PDF appears to be a copy of the Constitution of India. It includes the preamble, which outlines the objectives of the constitution, as well as various provisions and schedules that govern different aspects of Indian society and government. The document is divided into parts, sections, and schedules, and includes provisions for repeal, substitution, and retrospective effect.
can you tell me about human rights

Human rights are the fundamental rights that belong to every individual by virtue of their humanity. These rights include the right to privacy, the right to human dignity, the right to travel abroad, the right against torture, cruel or unusual punishment or degrading treatment, such as solitary confinement, the right to speedy trial, the right to free legal aid in criminal trial, the right against delayed execution, the right against custodian violence, the rights to shelter, to doctor's assistance, the right to health, the right to pollution-free environment, the right to education of a child until he attains the age of 14, and the freedom of Press, and right to listen, and right to know. These rights are enshrined in various international human rights treaties and conventions, including the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights, and the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights. It is important for individuals, governments, and organizations to respect, protect, and promote these rights in order to ensure that everyone can live with dignity and freedom.
